00032 @interface SBJsonParser ()

00037 - (BOOL)scanRestOfDictionary:(NSMutableDictionary **)o;

00053 #define skipWhitespace(c) while (isspace(*c)) c++
00054 #define skipDigits(c) while (isdigit(*c)) c++
00055 
00056 
00057 @implementation SBJsonParser
00058 
00059 static char ctrl[0x22];
00060 
00061 + (void)initialize
00062 {
00063     ctrl[0] = '\"';
00064     ctrl[1] = '\\';
00065     for (int i = 1; i < 0x20; i++)
00066         ctrl[i+1] = i;
00067     ctrl[0x21] = 0;    
00068 }
00069 
00074 - (id)fragmentWithString:(id)repr {
00075     [self clearErrorTrace];
00076     
00077     if (!repr) {
00078         [self addErrorWithCode:EINPUT description:@"Input was 'nil'"];
00079         return nil;
00080     }
00081     
00082     depth = 0;
00083     c = [repr UTF8String];
00084     
00085     id o;
00086     if (![self scanValue:&o]) {
00087         return nil;
00088     }
00089     
00090     // We found some valid JSON. But did it also contain something else?
00091     if (![self scanIsAtEnd]) {
00092         [self addErrorWithCode:ETRAILGARBAGE description:@"Garbage after JSON"];
00093         return nil;
00094     }
00095         
00096     NSAssert1(o, @"Should have a valid object from %@", repr);
00097     return o;    
00098 }
00099 
00100 - (id)objectWithString:(NSString *)repr {
00101 
00102     id o = [self fragmentWithString:repr];
00103     if (!o)
00104         return nil;
00105     
00106     // Check that the object we've found is a valid JSON container.
00107     if (![o isKindOfClass:[NSDictionary class]] && ![o isKindOfClass:[NSArray class]]) {
00108         [self addErrorWithCode:EFRAGMENT description:@"Valid fragment, but not JSON"];
00109         return nil;
00110     }
00111 
00112     return o;
00113 }
00114 
00115 /*
00116  In contrast to the public methods, it is an error to omit the error parameter here.
00117  */
00118 - (BOOL)scanValue:(NSObject **)o
00119 {
00120     skipWhitespace(c);
00121     
00122     switch (*c++) {
00123         case '{':
00124             return [self scanRestOfDictionary:(NSMutableDictionary **)o];
00125             break;
00126         case '[':
00127             return [self scanRestOfArray:(NSMutableArray **)o];
00128             break;
00129         case '"':
00130             return [self scanRestOfString:(NSMutableString **)o];
00131             break;
00132         case 'f':
00133             return [self scanRestOfFalse:(NSNumber **)o];
00134             break;
00135         case 't':
00136             return [self scanRestOfTrue:(NSNumber **)o];
00137             break;
00138         case 'n':
00139             return [self scanRestOfNull:(NSNull **)o];
00140             break;
00141         case '-':
00142         case '0'...'9':
00143             c--; // cannot verify number correctly without the first character
00144             return [self scanNumber:(NSNumber **)o];
00145             break;
00146         case '+':
00147             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"Leading + disallowed in number"];
00148             return NO;
00149             break;
00150         case 0x0:
00151             [self addErrorWithCode:EEOF description:@"Unexpected end of string"];
00152             return NO;
00153             break;
00154         default:
00155             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: @"Unrecognised leading character"];
00156             return NO;
00157             break;
00158     }
00159     
00160     NSAssert(0, @"Should never get here");
00161     return NO;
00162 }
00163 
00164 - (BOOL)scanRestOfTrue:(NSNumber **)o
00165 {
00166     if (!strncmp(c, "rue", 3)) {
00167         c += 3;
00168         *o = [NSNumber numberWithBool:YES];
00169         return YES;
00170     }
00171     [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description:@"Expected 'true'"];
00172     return NO;
00173 }
00174 
00175 - (BOOL)scanRestOfFalse:(NSNumber **)o
00176 {
00177     if (!strncmp(c, "alse", 4)) {
00178         c += 4;
00179         *o = [NSNumber numberWithBool:NO];
00180         return YES;
00181     }
00182     [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: @"Expected 'false'"];
00183     return NO;
00184 }
00185 
00186 - (BOOL)scanRestOfNull:(NSNull **)o {
00187     if (!strncmp(c, "ull", 3)) {
00188         c += 3;
00189         *o = [NSNull null];
00190         return YES;
00191     }
00192     [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: @"Expected 'null'"];
00193     return NO;
00194 }
00195 
00196 - (BOOL)scanRestOfArray:(NSMutableArray **)o {
00197     if (maxDepth && ++depth > maxDepth) {
00198         [self addErrorWithCode:EDEPTH description: @"Nested too deep"];
00199         return NO;
00200     }
00201     
00202     *o = [NSMutableArray arrayWithCapacity:8];
00203     
00204     for (; *c ;) {
00205         id v;
00206         
00207         skipWhitespace(c);
00208         if (*c == ']' && c++) {
00209             depth--;
00210             return YES;
00211         }
00212         
00213         if (![self scanValue:&v]) {
00214             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description:@"Expected value while parsing array"];
00215             return NO;
00216         }
00217         
00218         [*o addObject:v];
00219         
00220         skipWhitespace(c);
00221         if (*c == ',' && c++) {
00222             skipWhitespace(c);
00223             if (*c == ']') {
00224                 [self addErrorWithCode:ETRAILCOMMA description: @"Trailing comma disallowed in array"];
00225                 return NO;
00226             }
00227         }        
00228     }
00229     
00230     [self addErrorWithCode:EEOF description: @"End of input while parsing array"];
00231     return NO;
00232 }
00233 
00234 - (BOOL)scanRestOfDictionary:(NSMutableDictionary **)o 
00235 {
00236     if (maxDepth && ++depth > maxDepth) {
00237         [self addErrorWithCode:EDEPTH description: @"Nested too deep"];
00238         return NO;
00239     }
00240     
00241     *o = [NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithCapacity:7];
00242     
00243     for (; *c ;) {
00244         id k, v;
00245         
00246         skipWhitespace(c);
00247         if (*c == '}' && c++) {
00248             depth--;
00249             return YES;
00250         }    
00251         
00252         if (!(*c == '\"' && c++ && [self scanRestOfString:&k])) {
00253             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: @"Object key string expected"];
00254             return NO;
00255         }
00256         
00257         skipWhitespace(c);
00258         if (*c != ':') {
00259             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: @"Expected ':' separating key and value"];
00260             return NO;
00261         }
00262         
00263         c++;
00264         if (![self scanValue:&v]) {
00265             NSString *string = [NSString stringWithFormat:@"Object value expected for key: %@", k];
00266             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSE description: string];
00267             return NO;
00268         }
00269         
00270         [*o setObject:v forKey:k];
00271         
00272         skipWhitespace(c);
00273         if (*c == ',' && c++) {
00274             skipWhitespace(c);
00275             if (*c == '}') {
00276                 [self addErrorWithCode:ETRAILCOMMA description: @"Trailing comma disallowed in object"];
00277                 return NO;
00278             }
00279         }        
00280     }
00281     
00282     [self addErrorWithCode:EEOF description: @"End of input while parsing object"];
00283     return NO;
00284 }
00285 
00286 - (BOOL)scanRestOfString:(NSMutableString **)o 
00287 {
00288     *o = [NSMutableString stringWithCapacity:16];
00289     do {
00290         // First see if there's a portion we can grab in one go. 
00291         // Doing this caused a massive speedup on the long string.
00292         size_t len = strcspn(c, ctrl);
00293         if (len) {
00294             // check for 
00295             id t = [[NSString alloc] initWithBytesNoCopy:(char*)c
00296                                                   length:len
00297                                                 encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding
00298                                             freeWhenDone:NO];
00299             if (t) {
00300                 [*o appendString:t];
00301                 [t release];
00302                 c += len;
00303             }
00304         }
00305         
00306         if (*c == '"') {
00307             c++;
00308             return YES;
00309             
00310         } else if (*c == '\\') {
00311             unichar uc = *++c;
00312             switch (uc) {
00313                 case '\\':
00314                 case '/':
00315                 case '"':
00316                     break;
00317                     
00318                 case 'b':   uc = '\b';  break;
00319                 case 'n':   uc = '\n';  break;
00320                 case 'r':   uc = '\r';  break;
00321                 case 't':   uc = '\t';  break;
00322                 case 'f':   uc = '\f';  break;                    
00323                     
00324                 case 'u':
00325                     c++;
00326                     if (![self scanUnicodeChar:&uc]) {
00327                         [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description: @"Broken unicode character"];
00328                         return NO;
00329                     }
00330                     c--; // hack.
00331                     break;
00332                 default:
00333                     [self addErrorWithCode:EESCAPE description: [NSString stringWithFormat:@"Illegal escape sequence '0x%x'", uc]];
00334                     return NO;
00335                     break;
00336             }
00337             CFStringAppendCharacters((CFMutableStringRef)*o, &uc, 1);
00338             c++;
00339             
00340         } else if (*c < 0x20) {
00341             [self addErrorWithCode:ECTRL description: [NSString stringWithFormat:@"Unescaped control character '0x%x'", *c]];
00342             return NO;
00343             
00344         } else {
00345             NSLog(@"should not be able to get here");
00346         }
00347     } while (*c);
00348     
00349     [self addErrorWithCode:EEOF description:@"Unexpected EOF while parsing string"];
00350     return NO;
00351 }
00352 
00353 - (BOOL)scanUnicodeChar:(unichar *)x
00354 {
00355     unichar hi, lo;
00356     
00357     if (![self scanHexQuad:&hi]) {
00358         [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description: @"Missing hex quad"];
00359         return NO;        
00360     }
00361     
00362     if (hi >= 0xd800) {     // high surrogate char?
00363         if (hi < 0xdc00) {  // yes - expect a low char
00364             
00365             if (!(*c == '\\' && ++c && *c == 'u' && ++c && [self scanHexQuad:&lo])) {
00366                 [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description: @"Missing low character in surrogate pair"];
00367                 return NO;
00368             }
00369             
00370             if (lo < 0xdc00 || lo >= 0xdfff) {
00371                 [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description:@"Invalid low surrogate char"];
00372                 return NO;
00373             }
00374             
00375             hi = (hi - 0xd800) * 0x400 + (lo - 0xdc00) + 0x10000;
00376             
00377         } else if (hi < 0xe000) {
00378             [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description:@"Invalid high character in surrogate pair"];
00379             return NO;
00380         }
00381     }
00382     
00383     *x = hi;
00384     return YES;
00385 }
00386 
00387 - (BOOL)scanHexQuad:(unichar *)x
00388 {
00389     *x = 0;
00390     for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
00391         unichar uc = *c;
00392         c++;
00393         int d = (uc >= '0' && uc <= '9')
00394         ? uc - '0' : (uc >= 'a' && uc <= 'f')
00395         ? (uc - 'a' + 10) : (uc >= 'A' && uc <= 'F')
00396         ? (uc - 'A' + 10) : -1;
00397         if (d == -1) {
00398             [self addErrorWithCode:EUNICODE description:@"Missing hex digit in quad"];
00399             return NO;
00400         }
00401         *x *= 16;
00402         *x += d;
00403     }
00404     return YES;
00405 }
00406 
00407 - (BOOL)scanNumber:(NSNumber **)o
00408 {
00409     const char *ns = c;
00410     
00411     // The logic to test for validity of the number formatting is relicensed
00412     // from JSON::XS with permission from its author Marc Lehmann.
00413     // (Available at the CPAN: http://search.cpan.org/dist/JSON-XS/ .)
00414     
00415     if ('-' == *c)
00416         c++;
00417     
00418     if ('0' == *c && c++) {        
00419         if (isdigit(*c)) {
00420             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"Leading 0 disallowed in number"];
00421             return NO;
00422         }
00423         
00424     } else if (!isdigit(*c) && c != ns) {
00425         [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"No digits after initial minus"];
00426         return NO;
00427         
00428     } else {
00429         skipDigits(c);
00430     }
00431     
00432     // Fractional part
00433     if ('.' == *c && c++) {
00434         
00435         if (!isdigit(*c)) {
00436             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"No digits after decimal point"];
00437             return NO;
00438         }        
00439         skipDigits(c);
00440     }
00441     
00442     // Exponential part
00443     if ('e' == *c || 'E' == *c) {
00444         c++;
00445         
00446         if ('-' == *c || '+' == *c)
00447             c++;
00448         
00449         if (!isdigit(*c)) {
00450             [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"No digits after exponent"];
00451             return NO;
00452         }
00453         skipDigits(c);
00454     }
00455     
00456     id str = [[NSString alloc] initWithBytesNoCopy:(char*)ns
00457                                             length:c - ns
00458                                           encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding
00459                                       freeWhenDone:NO];
00460     [str autorelease];
00461     if (str && (*o = [NSDecimalNumber decimalNumberWithString:str]))
00462         return YES;
00463     
00464     [self addErrorWithCode:EPARSENUM description: @"Failed creating decimal instance"];
00465     return NO;
00466 }
00467 
00468 - (BOOL)scanIsAtEnd
00469 {
00470     skipWhitespace(c);
00471     return !*c;
00472 }
